case_title: Messrs AL-NOOR through Partner vs The PROVINCE OF SINDH through Chief Secretary Sindh and 8 others
respondant: The PROVINCE OF SINDH through Chief Secretary Sindh

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Violation of Sindh Public Procurement Act, 2009

complaint_summary: Plaintiff alleged favoritism and manipulation in awarding seven government tenders, claiming bids were fraudulently ignored despite compliance with submission requirements.
investigation_summary: Plaintiff presented evidence of bid submission, including Pay Orders verified by the bank. KDA failed to provide original minutes of proceedings and relied on an evaluation report prepared after the tenders were opened.
judgment_summary: The court found the tender process lacked transparency and was tainted with favoritism. It set aside the award of tenders and ordered re-advertisement with revised Engineer's Estimates and proper acknowledgment procedures.
Decision_or_verdict: Application allowed; award of tenders set aside.
legal_arguments: Plaintiff argued that bids were ignored despite compliance and presence during submission.
Defendants claimed Plaintiff did not submit bids and failed to approach the Grievance Redressal Committee.
Court ruled that Plaintiff's evidence of Pay Orders and attendance sheet supported their claim of participation.

witness_statement.Plaintiff's representative: Confirmed presence during bid submission and recitation of Quran verses at the opening proceedings.

maxims.De minimis: The law does not concern itself with trifles.

legal_terms.Grievance Redressal Committee: A body established under procurement rules to address complaints.

words_and_phrases.Favoritism: Unfair preference shown to certain bidders.
words_and_phrases.Transparency: Clear and open procedures in public procurement.

summary_vector_notes: The judgment highlights issues of favoritism and lack of transparency in public procurement processes. It emphasizes the importance of realistic Engineer's Estimates and proper acknowledgment procedures to ensure fairness.
